Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lekanis lid; interior: glazed (fired brown) with two added red bands; exterior: above, rays overlapping two black lines; below, black-figure decoration consisting of hoplite battle; of first warrior only lower body missing; he wears crested helmet and holds Boeotian shield in left hand; of second warrior, fleeing and turning back, only part of right arm holding spear is missing; he holds a round shield, painted white; rump of horse to right and possible white traces.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
